column1: length ball in the corridor, Rohit goes for the drive and gets beaten, bounce well in front of the keeper
short of length outside off, Rohit waits on the back foot and steers it towards third man

length ball on the stumps, just holds it its line to rap the batsman on the back thigh, a mild appeal for lbw but too high I think, the batsmen complete a leg bye as the ball rolls towards cover-point
length ball around off, Rohit plays it towards cover with soft hands and scampers to the other end for one more
slower length ball, angling across the batsman, de Kock was looking to play it on the leg side, ends up playing it on to his pads, was a knuckle ball from Ishant
length ball on the pads and flicked away in front of square, deep square leg moves across to his right to cut it off
length ball outside off, stays back and dabs it behind point
back of length around off and angling away, de Kock stays back and flicks it towards short midwicket
length ball around middle and leg this time, flicked towards short fine leg
creamed through covers! Rabada pitches one up around off and Rohit just leans into the extra cover drive, first boundary of the innings
back of length around off, dabbed towards covers, wanted a single but sent back by his partner
short of length around off, Rohit goes for the pull but ends up dragging it towards square leg
fuller on middle and leg, flicked towards the left of fine leg, only single though
short of length on the leg stump, de Kock was looking to come down the track but had to tuck it in front of square in the end
length ball outside off, Rohit comes down the track and looks to smash it over the bowler's head, misses it completely
length ball on the stumps, a bit of inwards movement, tucked away towards mid-on
length ball outside off, de Kock uses his feet, stays leg side of the ball and steers it towards extra cover, scampers through for a quick single
short of length outside off, Rohit goes for the pull, was early in the shot. The ball doesn't bounce as much either and hits him near the rib area
starts with a fuller delivery on the pads, flicked uppishly towards deep midwicket, the bat turning at the point of impact
short of length outside off, goes for the pull but gets an inside edge past the stumps, four to fine leg and that's 8000 runs for him in T20s
fuller on the stumps this time and Rohit presents the full face of the bat, mid-on cuts it off though
a low full toss outside off, de Kock comes forward and just chips it between the umpire and the non-striker
short of length and angling away, de Kock goes for the pull but the ball keeps a bit low, just misses the off stump
a length ball on the stumps, de Kock comes down and goes for the pull, gets the timing right this time to send it all the way over deep square leg
fuller on middle and leg, Rohit eases it towards deep midwicket with a flick
length ball, de Kock comes down and looks to give himself some room, Ishant though follows the batsman, and in the end de Kock can just steer it towards extra cover for a single
length outside off, Rohit clears his front leg and smashes it hard, beats the mid-off fielder on his right for a four
fuller on the stumps and Rohit heaves it towards deep midwicket, not that great timing and hence, just a single
length ball, de Kock is once again looking to create some room and hit through the off side, Ishant once again follows him, dabbed towards cover-point in the end
length outside off, Rohit stands tall and looks to punch it through covers, the lack of pace means the ball hits the inner half and dribbles towards mid-on
short of length outside off, stands tall and punches it towards extra cover
back of length outside off, punches it towards the left of Morris at extra cover who slides and fires in the throw at the bowler's end, Rohit was well in
short of length, de Kock uses his feet and then pulls it into the orbit over deep square leg for another six
fuller outside off, squeezes it towards cover, straight to the fielder
length ball on the stumps, a slower one at 114 kph, flicks it towards deep midwicket
a high full toss outside off, Rohit comes down and smashes it over deep square, just clearing the man at the boundary. Called no-ball for height
length but wide outside off, Rohit reaches for it and toe-ends it towards mid-off
bowled 'im! Length ball on the stumps, kept a little low, Rohit was playing inside the line as well, not a straight bat either and all that means the stumps are rattled
a tossed up googly outside off, Cutting comes forward and defends
length ball around off, stays back and works it towards midwicket
fuller on the leg stump, de Kock looks to sweep but misses, gets hit on the pads
flatter on the stumps, goes back and pulls, cannot get past short midwicket
flatter on the stumps once more, backs away and late-cuts it towards short third man
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts hard but cannot beat the point fielder
length on middle and leg, looks to smash it on the leg side, ends up more like dragging towards deep backward square leg
length around off, stays back and nudges it towards covers for a quick single
fuller on the stumps, clears his front leg, hits it towards deep midwicket, along the ground
trapped in front, length ball pitching outside off and coming in with the arm, Cutting goes down the sweep it fine but misses as rapped low in front of off and middle
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards long-off
tossed up around off, comes forward and defends with soft hands
fuller and down the leg side, swept hard towards the left of fine leg
a googly pitching on a length, de Kock goes the sweep and misses, trapped in front but it pitched outside leg. So the lbw appeal has been denied
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and drives back, Mishra goes low, gets his right hand to it but cannot makes a stop
de Kock once again targets the deep midwicket area, length ball on the stumps, clears his front leg and smashes it away for a boundary
length ball on the stumps, goes back and works it towards long-on
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and drives it towards wide long-on
fuller around off, driven towards long-off for another single
fuller outside off, goes for the slog sweep but doesn't get the timing right, a single to deep midwicket

de Kock has been run-out. A length ball outside off, Suryakumar cuts it towards point where Rabada fields and back flicks to the keeper, Surya took a step or two down and de Kock committed to it before Surya turned his back on his partner, resulting in both batsmen at the same end. Pant then relays the ball to Axar who breaks the stumps
length ball outside off, punched towards sweeper cover for one
length ball on the stumps, Surya goes down and scoops it over the keeper's head for a boundary
short outside off and spinning away, pulled away towards deep midwicket for a couple
length outside off, slow turn, cut away towards deep extra cover
fuller around off, comes forward and punches it towards long-off
fuller on middle and leg, chipped uppishly towards wide long-on, only a single though
length outside off, goes back and finds point with the cut shot
length ball, goes straight on back to him, and he defends
cuts a length ball to point
length, and he goes back and punches this towards sweeper cover
uses his feet to get down to a length ball, and biffs this down to long off
shorter ball, goes on with the arm, and he whips this towards deep midwicket with a flourish of his wrists
punches a length ball down towards long on
slower ball, outside off, keeps very low, and he dabs this down towards short third man
length, comes back into him, and strikes him on the pads as he shapes to whip this away on the onside. There's a muted appeal from Paul, because there was a thick inside edge
slower ball, short, outside off, and he whips this off the back foot towards deep midwicket
fuller ball, outside off, and he drives this to long off
slower ball, way outside off, and he swings this around to deep midwicket. Probably would have been called wide, had he left it alone
slower off-cutter, and he shapes to run this towards short third man, but misses out completely
short of a length, angles into him, and he whips this away towards long leg
short, angles across him, and he dabs this down towards third man with a dead bat
short ball, and he plays this very late, and delicate! Waits for the ball to come on to him, and then just nudges it over Pant behind the stumps with a horizontal bat
short, and he swings this away with an under edge down towards fine leg
short, and he whips it off the hips towards backward square leg. Brings up 100 for Mumbai Indians
fuller ball, faster at nearly 144kph, and he drives it back to the bowler
fuller ball, wide outside off, and he looks to swing this over midwicket, but misses
full, wide outside off again, and he lofts this towards long off
flat, and he drives it back towards Axar, who dives away to his right and stops this. Excellent stuff from the bowler!
length, and he makes some room to punch this towards cover. Prithvi Shaw has to move to his left to stop this
length, flat and quick, and he punches it towards long on
short, and he whips this down towards long on

GOT 'IM! Slower ball from Rabada, that just sticks on the pitch a bit, and Yadav shapes to scoop this over the fine leg fielder, but the outside edge carries it away towards Rishabh Pant's right, and he takes a superlative catch diving away
slower, short ball, and he swivel pulls this towards deep midwicket. Wants two, but will have to settle for the single
fuller ball, and he whips this towards midwicket, but cannot beat a diving Keemo Paul inside the circle
full ball, but down the pads, and Krunal gets some bat on it. Leg glance down to fine leg...could this be the push he needs to kick on from here?
looks for the yorker, but goes full, and he punches this down to long on
short ball, and dug in to the pitch. Hardik was shaping to look for the pull, but that hurries on to him at 149kph, and he eventually just blocks it with a dead bat
slower ball, down the leg side, and he whips this towards long leg
length, outside off, and he drives it back to Morris. Crisply timed, but couldn't evade the bowler
yorker, and he digs it down to deep midwicket
fuller, angles across him, and he gets an inside edge down towards fine leg as he shapes to drive
length, and he pushes this down towards long on
full, outside off, and he has slashed this away past point. Good shot by Krunal Pandya to end the over on a positive note!
length, outside off, and he hits this hard, but cannot beat the sweeper cover with a whippy shot
full ball, and he has played this brilliantly! Third man inside the ring, and he just uses the 135kph pace on the ball to squeeze it past the man at short third man, and gets it fine enough
slower ball, length, on the pads, and he has flicked this away towards deep midwicket
length ball, straight, and he has whipped this away dismissively towards the deep midwicket fence. Uses the depth of the crease expertly
slower ball, but he has spotted this one. Picks it up, and whacks it over long off, and sends it a few rows back!
slower ball again, and he has lofted this towards long on. Morris comes across to cut it off
full ball, and he digs out a yorker between his legs towards short fine leg. The Natmeg!
yorker again, and this time he toe-ends it towards backward square leg. Examines his bat at the end of that ball
looks for the yorker, but gets it too far down the leg side. Will have to rebowl this one
slower ball, length, and he has scooped this up in the air. But it lands in between the fielder at short midwicket, and long on. Very lucky!
full ball, and he whips this away towards deep midwicket
full toss, and he has whipped this away towards long leg. And got it all the way for SIX!
full toss on the leg side again, and he has whipped this away through fine leg again
yorker, but goes down the leg side. No margin for error on the on side, remember
full ball, and he biffs this down towards long off. The man there, Morris, is a few yards in, and has a shy at the non-striker's end, but misses. Would have been a goner!
pulls out the helicopter shot to a full ball on leg stump. SIX! Stays deep in his crease, and just hammers it over deep midwicket

short, and Rabada has his revenge here! Change in pace, off-cutter, and Hardik looks to go over square leg, and gets a top edge. It flies high in the night sky, and Pant gets under it and completes the catch. This has been a special cameo from Hardik, though. Just what Mumbai needed
slower ball, outside off, and he looks to cut this. Called a wide. A bit harsh, maybe?
full ball, on the pads, and he has whipped this towards midwicket. A bit of a left-handed helicopter from Krunal
length, and he cuts this towards point. Gets the outside edge, as he was shaping to slap this over covers. The edge takes it away towards the unprotected backward point fence
short ball, and he plays this towards long leg. Called a leg bye, and they pick one in the end, after some frantic running by Pandya
short of length outside off, Shaw stays back and steers it towards cover
short and wide and Shaw cuts it past the point fielder, off the mark with a cracking four
length ball but on the pads, glanced fine for back to back fours
length around off, stays in the crease and defends
back of length around off, Shaw stays back, gets on his toes and works it towards mid-on
length around off, gets behind the line and punches it back. Two boundaries and four dots from the first over
length ball on the pads, flicked away towards short fine leg
length around off, Dhawan goes down and sweeps it hard, beats the man at backward square leg
fuller around off, clipped away towards short midwicket
swept again, four again! Fuller on middle and leg and Dhawan this time goes finer, between short fine leg and square leg
length ball around middle and off, defended from the crease
down the track and smashes it hard, Chahar gets his boot in the way but it still carries almost all the way to the straight boundary where Pollard from long-on cuts it off
starts with a slower one on the stumps, clipped in front of square
another slower one, Dhawan skips down the track and hits it towards extra cover
though another slower ball, it's fuller and wider this time, and Dhawan smashes it through covers for four
slower length ball, fourth in a row, comes forward and taps it towards cover-point
another slower one, this is becoming too predictable I think. Dhawan comes down the track and smashes it over extra cover this time
finally one at 135 kph, length around off, Dhawan walks towards the bowler and taps it towards mid-off for a quick single
fuller on the stumps, pushed towards covers, wanted a single but Shaw sends him back
down the track and looks to work it on the leg side, Yadav follows him, a leading edge goes through extra cover
fuller once more, pushed towards mid-on for a single
almost chopped on! Length outside off, Shaw goes for the cut but gets an under edge into the ground
worked towards long-on for a single
down the track, reaches to the pitch of the ball and smashes it over long-on for a maximum
length outside off, angling in to the batsman and keeping a bit low as well, Shaw was looking to steer it away but the ball sneaks in between the bat and the stumps
length ball on the stumps, clipped away towards fine leg
length ball around off, comes down the wicket and drives it on the up, straight towards cover though
use of feet once again, Bumrah follows the batsman with a short of length delivery, dabbed it towards covers
length outside off, goes for the cut, doesn't middle it but a misfield by Suryakumar Yadav at extra cover allows single
length around off, stays back and dabs it towards cover-point for a quick single
fuller on the stumps, goes down and sweeps it towards deep backward square leg

once again some miscommunication between these two, length outside off, turns it towards square leg, Dhawan is charging towards the other end, Shaw sends him. A direct hit and Dhawan would have been gone despite his dive
length outside off, goes for the cut but it's not an easy pitch for that shot, chops it back towards the bowler
length ball, worked towards deep midwicket for a single
too full on the leg stump, Dhawan comes forward and chips it towards deep midwicket for a one-bounce four
down the track but Yadav has bowled this cleverly on the leg stump, Dhawan misses and gets rapped on the pads
short of length outside off and spinning away, Shaw once again goes for the cut but fails to connect
short of length on the stumps, pulls it towards deep square leg

an appeal for lbw but the stumps have lit up. Length ball outside leg, Dhawan goes for the reverse sweep but fails in execution, the ball hits the pads and ricochets on to the stumps off the bat. Mumbai have broken through
length ball on the stumps, defended from the back foot
length ball down the leg side and spinning further away
short of length outside off, punched towards extra cover
length ball on the stumps, worked away towards deep midwicket
length around off, stays back and punches it towards long-on
fuller around off from round the wicket, smashes it towards long-off, Pollard there
length outside off, cuts it towards wide long-off for one
length ball on the stumps, stays in his crease and defends
short outside off, cuts it away, Rohit dives to his right to make a partial stop
flatter and quicker on middle and leg, Shaw goes back and just manages to pull it towards fine leg
fuller around off, comes down the track and looks to go leg side, gets a leading edge towards wide long-off, the fielder slips there and that allows them to come back for the second

a dipping full toss on the leg stump, Shaw goes for the slog sweep and misses, an appeal for lbw but denied. Replays show the impact <s>might have been outside leg</s> was on the leg stump but since it hit him on the full, the projected path shows it would have missed the leg stump by some distance
Chahar gets his man. Shaw comes down the track to this tossed up delivery, but fails to middle it, Hardik takes an easy catch at long-on
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg for a single
length around off, comes forward and blocks it
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards square leg
flatter and quicker on the stumps, defended from the back foot
length ball on the stumps, goes back and flicks it towards square leg
fuller and quicker, 108.6 kph, on the stumps, pushed back towards the bowler
a yorker on the off stump, at 108 kph once again, Munro cannot get his bat down in time and Capitals lose their third wicket
length around off, spinning in to the batsman to take the inside edge on to the pads and roll towards short fine leg, Pant hares for the single, could have been close had the throw been accurate
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards deep midwicket
slider, outside off, and he misses out on an attempted cut
WHAT A BEAUTY! Tosses this up a bit, pitches on a length, and spins away from the leg stump towards off. Hits the top of off, as Iyer looks to defend this. Perfect ball for a leggie to have bowled
fuller ball, and he drives towards short midwicket
length, and he presses forward and gets an inside edge on to his pads
defends a length ball outside off
turns too much down the leg side
plays a delicate late cut towards third man. Just gets it past the man at first slip
fuller ball, and he drives this towards long off
full, on the pads, and he tucks this away towards backward square leg, and rushes through for a well-run two
length, and he punches this towards short cover
length, and he goes back to cut, but misses. Not far from the outside edge
fuller ball, and he dinks this towards square leg again. Wants two, but the Mumbai fielders converge on the ball quicker this time
length ball, and he has to defend this
short, and he looks to whip this through covers, but cannot beat short cover
fired flat across him, and he flicks this towards midwicket
fuller ball, and he hits this hard towards wide long off
full toss, and he looks to get this down towards short fine leg, but Malinga fields it. Gets away with this, really!
full ball, plays it away towards midwicket
full ball on the pads, and he flicks this away towards deep midwicket. Cutting comes around from backward square leg and cuts this off to save two runs for his team
full ball, wide, and Axar looks to go through the off side but misses out on contact
length ball, angles across him, and he punches this towards short cover
short, angles across him, and he guides this down towards third man. Gets it wide enough to pick up a couple
length ball, on off, and he pushes this towards cover

THAT COULD BE THE GAME! The move to bring back Bumrah pays off, as he gets a length ball to nip back just a bit off the seam. Pant looks for the heave-ho down the ground, but misses the line of it. It comes in a touch and knocks his off stump out of the ground. Bumrah lets out an exultant roar. Mumbai Indians are flying at the moment, through their balanced bowling attack
fast, outside off, and keeps a bit low as it beats Morris' outside edge
slower ball, on off stump, and he mistimes a cut towards short cover, right where Rohit Sharma has stationed himself
length, and he lofts this ball inside out. Hasn't timed it well enough to find the boundary, and Hardik Pandya gets to it from wide long off
full, wide, and he guides this down to third man
slower ball, full, on off stump, and he plays this down towards long on
slower ball, and he sets up to go through midwicket. Gets a slight edge towards the fielder there. There's a direct hit at the striker's end, but the deflection allows them to take the overthrow
slower ball, wide outside off, and he slices this inside out to the sweeper cover fence
length, and he picks this up and thumps it over long on. Terrific bit of timing!
short ball, a bit slower too, and Morris looks to drive this through covers, but the ball never really arrives. Bounces a couple of times on the way to de Kock
yorker, and he digs this out and gets it towards deep midwicket. They press hard for the second, and Axar Patel just about makes it at the non-striker's end. Was a sharp throw from Hardik Pandya
short, and he gets a hold of this, but there's a fielder at deep midwicket, where he swings this ball around
length ball, angles away from him, and takes the outside edge as Axar shapes to defend. Runs down towards third man. Good pace on that ball, and a hint of reverse swing too on a scruffy surface
looks for the yorker, and Morris takes it on the full, but his forced drive cannot beat cover
slower ball, and he has got a hold of this! Swings it away, picking it up from outside off, and through midwicket for a big six!
moves away, and picks up a slower, fuller ball and drives it towards cover
slower, fuller ball on off, and he digs it out towards short midwicket. Smart bowling
full ball, and he digs it out between his leg. The Natmeg again, but this time towards short midwicket. Can only get a couple here
yorker, and he digs it out towards cover

full, and he has swung this towards long on, where Hardik comes forward and takes a good, low catch. This was a useful resistance from Morris and Axar, but he had no option but to go for it, with the run rate required catching up to 21

fast, straight, and he defends this. Paul has come halfway down the track at the other end, and Bumrah gets to the ball, and throws the stumps down at the non-striker's end. Paul was still halfway down the pitch! Hard to say if there was a single there or not, but Paul was definitely not communicating well enough
BOWLED! Fast, full and accurate. Axar backs away looking to get this over the off side, and the ball goes through the gate and rattles his middle stump. BOOMRAH is in the house!
fast, length ball outside off, and he guides this towards third man
looks for a yorker, but ends up bowling a slightly high full toss. Rabada catches this on his pads as it runs towards third man
full, right in the blockhole, and Mishra defends this back towards the bowler
advances down the track and slogs a length ball towards mid off
length ball, and he slogs this towards deep midwicket
fuller, slower, and he guides this towards square leg. There's a shy at the stumps at the non-striker's end, but the fielder misses out on the direct hit
length, and he drives this towards the sweeper cover fielder
full ball, and he looks to get a leg glance going. Takes the pad and runs down to fine leg
looks for the yorker, but overcooks it. Will be called a wide, as it goes down the leg side again
slower ball, outside off, and he looks to drive this. Seems to get a bit of an outside edge, as it runs towards de Kock, but lands ahead of the keeper. They are able to pick up one
slower, outside off, and he looks to loft this towards long on. Pollard runs in, gets to it, and drops it! Wow...second drop in the last two games, isn't it? From Pollard?
slower ball, cuts across him, as Rabada loads up for a big heave on the onside, but misses
slower ball again, and this time he latches on to it and smashes this over midwicket. Big six!
fuller, straighter, and he misses out on an attempted forcing shot through the off side
length, wide of off stump, and he has looked to go inside out, and this time Pollard takes the catch running away to his right
length ball, and he backs away and slashes this towards backward point. Not sure he intended for the ball to go there, but the edge carries it finer than what he may have planned
short, and he biffs this away towards midwicket
